alert.note: Alert for Adams; Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 9:54AM CDT until April 16 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Wisconsin River at Castle Rock Dam affecting Adams and Juneau Counties. .Snow melt has increased the flows along the Wisconsin River. This will result in minor flooding for the Wisconsin River at Castle Rock starting This Afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wisconsin River at Castle Rock Dam. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 30,000 cfs, Localized flooding occurs near Highway Z and HH downstream of the dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:10 AM CDT Thursday the flow was 24,527 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 30,100 cfs this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood flow is 30,000 cfs. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CDT.
